text: Hello, I am new in HubSpot. I would like to develop a private app (as I don’t have access to webhooks) to update an external system when a ticket is created in HubSpot. Could anyone help me on this and point me to some documentation?
Think I am right in saying you need a public app as you will need webhooks to trigger your endpoints when a ticket is created on HubSpot?
From my understanding private apps let you make API calls but you need public app to allow web hooks calls, correct me if I am wrong anyone.
If you create a public app, you can just lock it down to the HubSpot account ID you want it to work with, this is what I am doing on my public app.
Thanks <@U056B0PPT7F>. I don’t have access to webhooks due to my license.

Can you show me where it says you can’t use web hooks? Any public app can use web hooks as far a so know and I could have free HubSpot account and pay for app in the store that utilizes web hooks and sure this would not be limited by me being on a free HubSpot account? I may be wrong but sounds odd.
